summary: The Fair and Open Competition Act of 2025 (FOCA Act of 2025) aims to promote open competition and government neutrality in federal and federally-funded construction projects. The bill prohibits federal agencies from requiring or prohibiting contractors from agreements with labor organizations, or discriminating based on labor affiliation. It mandates revisions to the Federal Acquisition Regulation, outlines exemptions, and defines key terms. The bill seeks to reduce construction costs, expand job opportunities, and prevent discrimination related to labor affiliations.
